10/10(for me ,objectively 8)
Adorable game, I hope they finish translating everything soon!

The lagging is less when turning v sync off, but with my computer specs (64GB ram), there is still obvious lag when the game auto saves. Heard the devs is a two-person team, but I still hope they fix it soon. Because so far, I love this game a lot and I hope more people can get to enjoy it.
This game is a bit larger than expected and it's so much fun just running around exploring. I saw some teleport spots but still couldn't have access to them, so doing tasks is still tiring based on how big the map is. But with all the little quirky ideas that made up most of the game, it's a fun and relaxing game to play after a long day. 
I saw some controller tutorials online, but I hope the team make it official so steamdeck can also be a playable option.
Cozy Island is relaxing, cute, and calming, Love it!

absolutely love this game. the wait was so worth it. it kind of feels like animal crossing, but 100x better. my bf and i have been playing it since the release date, love that's it's multiplayer. the only downside is that some things are in chinese so i don't understand it. other than that, i recommend it to everyone, even as a solo game, it's very fun. i also can't believe it's only $9, i feel like this game is worth way more

There are lots of bugs and unintential inconveniences BUT every moment is adorable. My partner gifted me a carrot outfit and I am happy.

Very charming game with surprisingly a lot of content! I played the demo and love it so I've been looking forward to this game but didn't expect it to be a game I'd play more than 2 hours or so. But there is so much to explore and many quests to complete - or not. The game doesn't force you to complete any achievements or quests so you can just goof around in the game with friends if you want. My only complaint is that I wish you could sprint; walking is slow.

This is a very charming and cute little game! I enjoy exploring the map and finding all kinds of different things to do: from different vehicles to drive, different treasure chests to find, crops to harvest, items to craft, outfits to wear, and races to be won.

Many aspects of [i]Cozy Island[/i] remind me of [i]Little Big Adventure[/i]â€”there are NPCs that dole out mini-quests and challenges, and the isometric perspective and control is similar. (There is also a first-person mode.)

I have not yet tried the multiplayer, but that would definitely be quite interesting. All-in-all, this title exceeded my expectations. It is low-pressure and relaxing.ğŸ«

$9 shot of dopamine and cozyness. Good vibes. Vehicle mechanics are janky, but I find it charming, and it doesn't make the game unplayable. I get to dress as a giant green worm 10/10

I really love this game, it's so cute. My only issue is the translation. Some parts of the game are not translated at all or translated in weird confusing English (the potion recipes. It took me a lot of ChatGPT conversations to actually get the correct ingredients). So I hope this gets fixed soon, because I wanna fully enjoy the game without the frustration of not knowing what the game wants from me
A cute, fun, silly, relaxing game. Lots to do lots of fun to be had! Some things are not yet translated into English but nothing important.

Played the pre-release thing sometime last year. Since then theres been a lot of changes added and all are positive. Theres some jankyness when hooking up the bins together but other than that its a really, really adorable and alluring game. Theres a lot of personality put into this and it will absorb all of your time wandering around exploring all it has to offer. Extremely charming, creative and I HIGHLY recommend playing and trying it out especially if you enjoy hoarding resources!

Best. Game. Ever.

You'll cry laugh yourself to death.

It is easier for us to keep track the mission by given by NPC. Cozy Island is basically Animal Crossingâ€™s chill cousin whoâ€™s permanently on vacation. negative.review:
Both really funny and also really cute, would be a lot better with a chat log in game though, and a couple of the tooltips are entirely in chinese and not translated.

edit a week later: the game now has a stamp on screen saying "trial version" despite not being in early access and being fully released. Messages and tooltips still often in chinese and lots of bugs still there, so changing to not recommended.

Feels more like a prototype, then a real game, Fun, but extremely short.
I've spent a few hours and there is nothing more to do.

For a game which calls itself "Cozy Island", it seems oddly centered around a lot of grinding. From my 1.2 hours of gameplay, the only thing I managed to find as an activity in this game is simply collecting various items or resources which either are used to get more of certain other items, traded for other items or is used to make acquiring other items easier. The only thing not exactly related to this was some sort of minigame of using a camera to take pictures of worms... but even this is grind-centered of "finding them all". Secondly, this game is very poorly optimised, I have an RTX 3060 GPU yet only managed to get around 40 fps in this game, changing the graphics settings didn't even help. What I can say I liked is how unserious this game is about itself and how the silliness of it feels quite entertaining even. I feel this game is marketing itself a bit inaccurately - this is not a game about relaxing around the island, it's about resource collection (at your own pace). If this is the kind of game you would enjoy, I'd recommend you try it, but if you are looking for just a relaxing experience, this game is not it.

This game is a mess. Game itself, displays itself as a Trial Version, despite the full release status and price. Look elsewhere to quench your cosy requirements.


Godspeed, gamers
Hi. Nice game and all for the kids but my 5 year old daughter cannot use the WSAD keys and there is no option to bind keys. Very short-sighted of the Devs
the game runs below 60 fps, unoptimize. i would recommend if performance is fixed. as it stand, no.

Both really funny and also really cute, would be a lot better with a chat log in game though, and a couple of the tooltips are entirely in chinese and not translated.

edit a week later: the game now has a stamp on screen saying "trial version" despite not being in early access and being fully released. Messages and tooltips still often in chinese and lots of bugs still there, so changing to not recommended.

Feels more like a prototype, then a real game, Fun, but extremely short.
I've spent a few hours and there is nothing more to do.

For a game which calls itself "Cozy Island", it seems oddly centered around a lot of grinding. From my 1.2 hours of gameplay, the only thing I managed to find as an activity in this game is simply collecting various items or resources which either are used to get more of certain other items, traded for other items or is used to make acquiring other items easier. The only thing not exactly related to this was some sort of minigame of using a camera to take pictures of worms... but even this is grind-centered of "finding them all". Secondly, this game is very poorly optimised, I have an RTX 3060 GPU yet only managed to get around 40 fps in this game, changing the graphics settings didn't even help. What I can say I liked is how unserious this game is about itself and how the silliness of it feels quite entertaining even. I feel this game is marketing itself a bit inaccurately - this is not a game about relaxing around the island, it's about resource collection (at your own pace). If this is the kind of game you would enjoy, I'd recommend you try it, but if you are looking for just a relaxing experience, this game is not it.

This game is a mess. Game itself, displays itself as a Trial Version, despite the full release status and price. Look elsewhere to quench your cosy requirements.


Godspeed, gamers
Hi. Nice game and all for the kids but my 5 year old daughter cannot use the WSAD keys and there is no option to bind keys. Very short-sighted of the Devs
the game runs below 60 fps, unoptimize. i would recommend if performance is fixed. as it stand, no.

Both really funny and also really cute, would be a lot better with a chat log in game though, and a couple of the tooltips are entirely in chinese and not translated.

edit a week later: the game now has a stamp on screen saying "trial version" despite not being in early access and being fully released. Messages and tooltips still often in chinese and lots of bugs still there, so changing to not recommended.

Feels more like a prototype, then a real game, Fun, but extremely short.
I've spent a few hours and there is nothing more to do.

For a game which calls itself "Cozy Island", it seems oddly centered around a lot of grinding. From my 1.2 hours of gameplay, the only thing I managed to find as an activity in this game is simply collecting various items or resources which either are used to get more of certain other items, traded for other items or is used to make acquiring other items easier. The only thing not exactly related to this was some sort of minigame of using a camera to take pictures of worms... but even this is grind-centered of "finding them all". Secondly, this game is very poorly optimised, I have an RTX 3060 GPU yet only managed to get around 40 fps in this game, changing the graphics settings didn't even help. What I can say I liked is how unserious this game is about itself and how the silliness of it feels quite entertaining even. I feel this game is marketing itself a bit inaccurately - this is not a game about relaxing around the island, it's about resource collection (at your own pace). If this is the kind of game you would enjoy, I'd recommend you try it, but if you are looking for just a relaxing experience, this game is not it.

This game is a mess. Game itself, displays itself as a Trial Version, despite the full release status and price. Look elsewhere to quench your cosy requirements.
